title: Worked Solution
text:
The correct answer is:

People fixate on the title and are more likely to accurately remember the data if the title says something about the data.

Explanation: Slide titles serve as cognitive anchors, guiding the audience's focus. When a title clearly reflects the content of the slide, it reinforces understanding and retention of the data presented. People tend to fixate on titles first, and if those titles are aligned with the key message, it helps the audience process and remember the information more effectively.
